newsitem.title: LATVIA: INVESTMENT BANK LAUNCHES LEASING FIRM.
newsitem.headline: INVESTMENT BANK LAUNCHES LEASING FIRM.

text.p: The Latvian Investment Bank said on Wednesday that it has launched a leasing company, Latvian Industrial Leasing Ltd (LIL), in partnership with international financial institutions.
"The company, the first international leasing company in Latvia, was established on June 20," Janis Buks, manager of LIL told a news conference.
The company is owned by the Investment bank and Estonian Industrial Leasing, 40 percent owned by Finnish Merita Finance.
LIL's clients will include producer or processing companies looking for industrial equipment and vehicles under medium and long-term financing schemes, Buks said.
LIL's basic capital is 340,000 lats or one million marks.
The leasing period ranges between two to five years and the interest rate can be either fixed or floating, based on six months mark LIBOR.
There were know-how and producer contact network reasons behind entering into a partnership, LIL's manager said.
"This gives us a possibility to draw on the more than 20-year long leasing experience of Merita Financing and make use of its vast network of sellers/producers," Buks said.
There are also significant synergies both for the bank and the leasing company in offering a package service, the bank's vice president Juris Jakobsons said.
"The bank can offer refinancing and additional loans for working capital," Jakobsons said. "LIL, in its turn, can serve our clients who have reached a loan ceiling of 1.2 million lats."
